Data - UI - Logic - UI
The Data category includes components that determine what data the app will be based on and how it will be stored and related. This includes tables, relationships, columns, choice columns, and lookup columns.
The UI category includes components that determine how the data will be displayed and edited on the app interface. This includes forms, views, charts, and dashboards.
The Logic category includes components that determine the business processes, rules, and automation the app will have. This includes business process flows, business rules, workflows, and actions.

Data - Data -Logic - Data
Explanation:
• The Data category includes components that determine what data the app will be based on and how it will be displayed and edited. This includes tables, relationships, columns, choice columns, forms, and views.
• The Logic category includes components that determine the business processes, rules, and automation the app will have. .
The Visualization category includes components that determine what type of data visualizations and reporting the app will have available.

Yes no yes
 This is true because the Power Apps canvas app authoring environment will automatically adapt to the language setting of the author. This means that the user interface and various elements of the app will be displayed in the language that the author has set on their device.

This is false, because when the canvas app is running on a mobile device, the app will adopt the language settings of the device, not the language settings of the app author. So, even if the app is authored in a different language, it will be displayed in the language of the device on which it is running.

This is true because PowerApps will automatically format numbers, date and currency based on the regional settings of the user's device. This means that when a user views the app on their device, the numbers, dates, and currency will be displayed in the format that is commonly used in their region.
